Bibliography

edition (genetic) | Van_Hulle2004

The genetic edition in the true sense of the word, according to Grésillon (1994, 198), should contain the reproduction of all the genetic documents, bibliographical descriptions, and an introduction regarding the location of the manuscript and the general history of its genesis, comprising letters and other relevant evidence.
